resources.string:
Phasmophobia is a unique horror game developed by Kinetic Games.

P.E.T. is an unofficial companion tool\-\- acting both as a guide for new players and as an assistant for the veterans.

Thank you so much for using P.E.T.!
Allow Message Center to use Mobile Data
Banshees are described as natural hunters. They will attempt to slowly stalk and pick off ghost hunters one by one by selectively targeting one investigator at a time.

A Demon is one of the worst ghosts to encounter. Being highly aggressive, it will attack more often than any other Ghost, so a crucifix is recommended to prevent Hunts. However, asking the demon successful questions from the Ouija Board will not drain the player\'s sanity.

The Deogen is a natural hunter. Conventional hiding methods will not work as it has a keen sense for sniffing out prey. You can run… but you can\'t hide. Repeat: DO NOT TRY TO HIDE. If you hear extremely rapid footsteps, like a drumroll, step out of hiding IMMEDIATELY.

A Goryo will rarely be seen outside of it\'s preferred room. A Goryo also heavily dislikes showing itself when people are nearby. This makes seeing D.O.T.S. impossible without viewing it through a video camera remotely.

The Hantu favors colder temperatures which will empower its ability to move quickly during a hunt. This means that the Circuit Breaker must be enabled in order to increase the overall temperature outside of the haunted area, thereby impairing the Hantu\'s movement speed.

A Jinn gets its abilities from the power being on. It can move very quick huring hunts and it can drain sanity absurdly fast. Jinns were the apex predator back in earlier versions of Phasmophobia, and there\'s good reason for that. It moves at 2.5 m/s if chasing a far away player and the generator is on, and 1.7 m/s if the generator is off and not chasing someone.
The Mare is a ghost that grows more aggressive in the dark.
The Moroi wick away the sanity of the living. As its victims sanity lowers, the Moroi grows stronger. Keep your Sanity as high as possible to avoid unwanted aggressiveness.

The Myling will emit strange noises which can be picked up by the Parabolic Microphone. Its footsteps can also only be heard within the electronic interference range (which is around 10 meters) during a Hunt.

An Obake is a shape shifter which promotes some unusual evidence at times. An Obake has a chance to not produce fingerprints at all, which may cause problems with evidence collection if negating Fingerprints too early.
The Oni is an aggressive ghost which scales its activity level with the number of nearby investigators. It is also likely to wander around near the Ghost Room.
The Onryo both dislikes and is highly threatened by any form of flame (including candles, lighter, etc). It will not hunt if attempting to within 4 meters of a flame source.
A Phantom is a fear-inducing ghost, quickly draining the sanity of those who look at it.
One of the most famous ghosts, a Poltergeist, also known as a noisy ghost, can manipulate multiple objects around it to spread fear into its victims.
A Raiju is a ghost which siphons electrical power from the devices around it. Too much electrical stimulation nearby it will cause it to become agitated and hunt more frequently.

A Revenant is best known for it\'s slow hunting behavior while searching for investigators. It\'s methodically slow while searching, which provides distinct hunting sounds that assist with determining this ghost type.
A Shade is considered to be a \"shy ghost\”. While it is harder to find evidence while investigators remain in groups, a Shade is far less likely to attack if there are multiple people nearby.
A Spirit has no special strengths, but it is still as dangerous as any other ghost.

The Thaye is an ghost which rapidly ages while in the presence of the living. The earthly representation of this aging will present itself as strength in the early stages of a mission, but as a weakness in the later stages. Asking a Thaye how old it is on the Ouija Board will produce a response that is proportional to its progressed age. With each progressed stage of aging, the Thaye will decrease it\'s effective speed by a rate of 0.175 m/s.

The Twins are a pair of two Ghosts which have the ability to separately manipulate their surroundings. One of the Twins is unable to manipulate motion sensors and will not leave deterministic Evidence. Either Twin may initiate and participate in a Hunt, but not both at the same time.

The Mimic is an elusive, mysterious copycat ghost that mirrors traits and behaviours from other ghost types. Keep an eye out for behaviour switching. Ghost Orbs are a fourth, hidden evidence that must be present for this ghost.
A Wraith is the only known Ghost which retains the ability of flight. Much like any other ghost, a Wraith cannot travel through walls even though they are said to have that ability.
The Yokai is highly sensitive to voices, making the Yokai extremely dangerous. However, speaking nearby it may also trigger activity, making finding the Ghost room easier.

A Yurei is a ghost whose ability increases the passive drain of a player\'s sanity (Although most ghosts drain your sanity rather quickly). Smudging the room a Yurei was found in will prevent it from wandering from the location for a long time.
The Banshee will focus on one player, and will swap to a new target if their selected target is not in the play-area.

They can be difficult to gather clues on as they will attack players very frequently. The Demon can early\-hunt at any sanity, but it\'s minimum target is normally around 70\% average sanity. It\'s hunt cooldown, or the time between hunts, is 20 seconds, which is 5 seconds faster than any other ghost. Smudge sticks also have a shorter protection period, granting 60 seconds of safety rather than the normal 90 seconds for non\-Spirit ghosts.

The Deogen will sense any living being, no matter how well hidden. Choosing to stay stationary against a Deogen will get you killed. Do not rely on breaking line-of-sight, as this will not stop a chase and will only allow the Deogen to move much quicker.
A Goryo often only shows itself on camera when there are no people nearby. This may cause problems with gathering the appropriate evidence, as it may lead to negating D.O.T.S. too early.
Lower temperatures allow the Hantu to move at faster speeds. Line of sight does not effect the Hantu\'s speed.

A Jinn\'s speed makes it an extremely difficult ghost to escape from once it begins hunting. Once the Jinn catches up to a player, it will deccelerate gradually and switch to normal hunting speeds. A Jinn may instantly remove 25\% sanity from a nearby player if the power is on.

A Mare will attempt to turn the lights off to empower itself, and will hunt at 60\% should the power be off. It will also wander into other rooms or into dark areas of its preferred room, and may start a hunt from those locations. A Mare has an increased likelihood to destroy a room\'s light source through an event.

The Moroi will take full advantage of every bit of Sanity lost. Less team Sanity will produce higher levels of aggressiveness. At 0% average Sanity, the ghost will become lightning fast during a hunt. Based on average team Sanity, its speed ranges between 1.5 m/s at it\'s slowest to 2.25 m/s at it\'s fastest.

The ghost has a hidden ability \-\- a curse \-\- which causes any player to drain in Sanity at a rate of .03\%/sec so long as the effected player is within the play area. This effect is caused if the player uses and gets a response from the Spirit Box. The effect stacks atop the normal rate at which players Sanity drains. Candles do not halt the effects, but the curse can be lifted upon the use of Sanity Pills.
A Myling is not as vocal as other Ghosts while Hunting. You will only detect their footsteps and their vocal noises while within the vicinity of electronic\-interference.
An Obake may not leave a trace when manipulating the environment. This means that it has a chance to not leave fingerprint evidence. The Obake may also decrease fingerprint lifetime by half.

Oni\'s possess the ability to move physical objects around like a Poltergeist, while also sporting the aggression of a Demon. This makes them challenging to gather evidence around without angering them. This is its greatest weakness, as it will likely reveal itself early in the round. If a player is touched by an Oni during a ghost event, the player will have their sanity drained by twice as much.

The Onryo will target the source of flame and extinguish it. Should the Onryo extinguish 3 flames, the Onryo may initiate a Hunt no matter the Sanity level if there is no other nearby flame or Crucifix. When a player dies, the odds of candles being extinguished from then on increases.

Phantoms will take an extreme toll on players\' sanity. Avoid being in the presence of, or looking directly at a Phantom for too long. It also has a tendency to passively follow players, which helps it to wander outside of its chosen room, making it more difficult to gather evidence.

Poltergeists can have a heavy influence on the space players are in, being capable of throwing numerous objects as well as producing loud noises. There is an immediate 2\% sanity drain on any nearby players per item thrown. This may occur both outside and during a hunt.

Raiju\'s become much faster while nearby electrical devices, but not the map power or room lights, and will increase it\'s preferred hunting sanity level to 65\% while nearby such electrical devices. If near an electronic equipment, it will travel at 2.5 m/s; Otherwise, it will travel at 1.7 m/s.

A Revenant will travel at 1 m/s while hunting for players, and will instantly travel at 3 m/s if the location of an player is known (via line-of-sight, proximity chat, or electronic device usage). It will slow down gradually to 1 m/s unless a player\'s location is reacquired after it reaches the player\'s last known location.

Shades can be difficult to find, and therefore it can be difficult to collect evidence for or even find the location of. It has a lower activity overall; however, lower player sanity levels will procure more ghost events. It will not interact or throw objects while a player is in it\'s preferred room.
Spirits have no strengths in particular, as they are geared towards new players. Don\'t be fooled, though. It\'s lack of specialty makes it an even match.

The Thaye will be most active and dangerous at the beginning of a mission. This makes it extremely threatening early on. The Thaye will hunt at 75% at the start of an investigation, eventually scaling to a minimum 15% after it finishes aging. A young Thaye will be very fast at 2.7 m/s, while an old Thaye will move slower than a player at 1.0 m/s.
Either Twin may be angered, and thus, either Twin may initiate a Hunt. This means that a hunt may start from two different locations.

The Mimic may rapidly copycat any ghost type multiple times during an investigation, which makes it extremely dangerous and totally unpredictable. The behavior that it copies can be present both during or outside of a hunt. The Mimic cannot swap to copycat a different ghost mid\-hunt.

The Wraith possesses the ability to blink themselves to the location of any nearby player within a small distance from their chosen room. This may take place far outside of their room, even between floors. This activity might go unnoticed as it may be a silent activity, but it will generate an EMF reading at the landing location. After this activity, the Wraith will walk back to their room and may interact with objects during this time. It is said that a Wraith may hunt right after teleporting, but this may be inaccurate.
Speaking nearby a Yokai will anger it, increasing it\'s likelihood to attack by raising the minimum preferred sanity level for hunting to 80\%.

Yurie\'s will drop players\' sanity, while they are looking at it, much quicker than any other ghost \-\- but can also decrease sanity even when a player is turned away. A Yurei may also instantly rip away 15\% sanity from any nearby player; and when this happens, the doors of the room will always close by themselves (any ghost may do this, but the Yurei has an increased likelihood).

A Banshee will wander far from its room just to stalk its target. Banshees will never kill its non-target player, and during a hunt it will walk straight through any investigator who it isn\'t interested in. It also bases its hunt on the Sanity of its target instead of the average Sanity of the team. A Banshee has a special interaction with the Parabolic Microphone as it has a chance to emmit a faint, high pitched wail.

Unlike other ghosts, asking a Demon a successful question via the Ouija Board will not lower players\' sanity. This makes the Ouija Board a very useful tool against Demons. Demons fear the Crucifix, increasing its effectiveness against them by amplifying the Crucifix effective range to 5 meters instead of the normal 3 meters for other ghosts.

The Deogen will stalk its prey to exhaustion, but it will never outpace it\'s prey. Stay on the move against this ghost and make sure to plan your routes ahead of time. Stay in line\-of\-sight with this ghost and you\'ll be fine as it will only be able to move at 0.4 m/s while in close proximity to the nearest player in line\-of\-sight. As long as you\'re within line\-of\-sight it will never be able to catch you, even if you\'re walking. The Deogen will only hunt at 40\% sanity.
Goryo\'s will normally stay within or very close to the location they\'re haunting. This allows for easier evidence collection.

A Hantu\'s movement will be slower than normal in warmer areas. While hunting, and if the breaker is off, the Hantu will produce freezing breath much like a player does, but this effect is not limited to the ghost room or the temperature of a room.

Jinns rely on the map\'s power source to achieve their high speeds, so players should look for the building\'s circuit breaker in order to remove the Jinn\'s ability. A Jinn will not be able to turn the power on itself.

Keeping the lights on in a Mare\'s area will lower its sanity preference for hunting from 60\% to 40\% average sanity. Therefore, remain in lit areas to limit its aggression. A Mare cannot turn the breaker off, but it does have the ability to instantly turn off light switches when they\'re activated by a player, which is an event that can be recognized very easily.
The Moroi are hypersensitive to the Smudge Stick. Lighting one nearby will blind the Moroi for 12 seconds.
Mylings will more frequently emit paranormal sounds in the parabolic microphone.

By chance, an Obake may sometimes leave 6-fingered handprints instead of the normal 5. 5-fingered handprints should not be used to rule out the Obake. The Obake may also change its ghost model for a brief second at any point both during a hunt. If the Obake touches a surface, there is a chance for fingerprints to not appear; This can be used as proof for the ghost if any following interactions produce fingerprints.

Onis are easy to find, as they can\'t resist causing a ruckus when players are nearby. The Oni cannot do a \"Ghost Mist\" or \"Ghost Ball\" event. It will favor full manifestations over shadow manifestations or invisible manifestations during ghost events. This behavior carries into hunts, which causes the Oni to manifest itself for longer periods and disappearing for very short intervals during hunts.
A flame source will act to quell an Onryo\'s chance to attack. It will first extinguish all flames (much like using a Crucifix charge) before using a Crucifix.

Taking a picture of a Phantom will make it disappear temporarily and will never show in the photograph. A Phantom also gives itself away huring hunts, as it will physically manifest for short durations and disappear for longer durations.

Players can remove physical objects in the room, rendering a Poltergeist ineffective. A Polgergeist may interact with items violently, being able to throw an item with far greater force than a normal ghost. It may interact with multiple items at the same time, which is known as a "Poltergeist explosion event", and it can be easily tested by accumulating a large number of items into a pile and observing its behavior for activity. During a hunt, items have a far greater chance of being manipulated, so check for numerous aggitated items within its hunting path.
It\'s easier to track a Raiju because they constantly manipulate electrical devices while hunting.
A Revenant will be very slow when player location is unknown, and very distinct, slow footsteps can be heard. The best way to determine if you have a revenant is through the hunt.

There\'s strength in numbers against a Shade, as they will not attack a group of people. If you want to prevent a hunt, at least one player must be within close proximity to the ghost. A Shade will also be more likely to show shadow-form models and conversely it has less likelihood of showing it\'s full model.
When a Spirit is smudged, it will not hunt for a full 180 seconds. By contrast, any other ghost will hunt at 90 seconds (except for the Demon which may hunt as early as 60 seconds).

The longer the ghost is in the presence of the living, it will decrease in aggressiveness, speed, and strength. Each age lowers the speed by 0.175 m/s. The Thaye also has no line\-of\-sight acceleration.

Due to their combined activity, locating The Twins should be much easier. The Twins have a varied hunting speed which randomly alternates between hunts. One Twin hunts at 90\% normal speed (1.5 m/s) while the other Twin hunts at 110\% normal speed (1.9 m/s).

A Ghost Orb will appear alongside the deterministic Evidence of The Mimic, which makes The Mimic the only ghost type to (technically) have a fourth piece of Evidence. The Ghost Orb behaves differently than normal, too. It follows The Mimic as it wanders, so keep an eye out for a roaming Ghost Orb while at high Team Sanity.

Salt is toxic to a Wraith, so therefore it will never step through any. To confirm a Wraith, place a motion sensor over Salt piles. If the Motion Sensor detects movement without the Salt being disturbed, the ghost may be a Wraith!

While Hunting, a Yokai will only hear voices within a close proximity to it. It can only hear proximity chat or detect electronic equipment within 2.5 meters of itself. The Music Box cursed possession also does not cause the Yokai to move until the player is within a much closer proximity than any other ghost would require.
Yureis are vulnerable to Smudge Sticks, and smudging the room successfully will cause the Yurei to remain in place for some time.

Hunts at 50\% Sanity of the Player it is targeting.

Completely ignores Average Sanity.

Normally hunts at 70\% Sanity.

May Hunt at any Sanity level upon ability activation.

Hunts at 40\% Sanity.

  • 3.0 m/s while sprinting to a hidden player\'s location.
  • 0.4 m/s or more while following an investigator closely.
  • 3.0 m/s or less to maintain close proximity to investigator.

Hunts at 50\% Sanity.

  • Moves 2.5 m/s while both chasing an investigator who is 3+ meters away and the Fuse Box is on.
  • Moves 1.7 m/s if not chasing anyone.

Hunts at 40\% Sanity if the Power is on.

Hunts at 60\% Sanity if the Power is off.

Normally hunts at 60\% Sanity.

May hunt at any Sanity if fire is extinguished.

Normally hunts at 50\% Sanity.

Hunts at 65\% Sanity if nearby powered\-on electronics.

  • Moves 2.5m/s if nearby electronic equipement
  • Moves 1.7 m/s if not nearby electronic equipment

Hunts at 50\% Sanity.

Movement speed: 1 m/s if not chasing; 3.0 m/s if chasing.

Incrementally ages in 10 stages and loses 0.175 m/s movement speed per stage.

Hunts at 75\% Sanity at it\'s youngest age. Max movement: 2.7 m/s

Hunts at 15\% Sanity at it\'s oldest age. Max movement: 1.0 m/s

Hunts at 50\% Sanity.

50% chance to be either twin during the hunt

  • Twin A: 1.5 m/s minimum
  • Twin B: 1.9 m/s minimum
Hunting preferences are based on the mimicked ghost. Therefore, The Mimic may hunt anywhere between 15% and 100% Sanity.

Hunts at 50\% Sanity.

Cannot hear investigators or sense electronic equipment.

The D.O.T.S. Projector is a device which may be placed on walls or the floor. It projects a matrix of bright dots, casting the dots across nearby surfaces around it.

To positively identify this Evidence, a silhouette of the ghost will be seen running, or crawling quickly, through the projection\'s beams. The silhouette may be seen by the naked eye or through a Video Camera, but is easier seen remotely via the Video Camera\'s Thermals. It\'s best to attempt to find this evidence remotely, as a Goryo\'s behavior may cause Evidence conflicts otherwise. The actual location of the Ghost will not dictate when the silhouette animations occur.

The D.O.T.S. visuals are now the actual ghost, meaning you will need to shine your Infrared lights near the ghost\'s actual position. This creates much more engaging gameplay for players, you can use D.O.T.S. to see where your ghost is, or if you\'re struggling to get the evidence, use Salt, Motion Sensors or other equipment to find a better spot for your Projector. Ghosts with D.O.T.S. evidence can now enter a short \“D.O.T.S. state\” when wandering; During which, they are temporarily visible with infrared light, during this time they will wander towards the nearest player (or to a random spot in the room if it\'s empty) before disappearing.
A Laser Grid Pen that is similar to a flashlight. You can walk around the location and scan quickly for evidence, the only downside being its short range and low light intensity.
This is the original D.O.T.S. projector. It is a placeable projector emitting an average\-sized sphere of light, except now you can encourage the ghost to walk into it by standing nearby.
Cranks up the light to the maximum. This placeable projector scans the room at a much longer range with a wide, sweeping beam of light, making finding ghosts in those bigger rooms much easier.

EMF\-5 is the highest Level reading from an EMF Reader.

A ghost produces EMF emissions from Levels 1 through 5 when it interacts in some way with the room or the Ouija Board. Light flickers, footsteps and other smaller passive interactions will typically give a lower reading. Heavier interactions, such as an appearance or a phone ringing, will almost always give a higher reading. Ghosts carrying this evidence will give EMF Level 5 only by chance, so this evidence may take some time to acquire.
An old\-analog Meter with a small detection range, low accuracy, and low audio emissions. The needle will go into overdrive when level 5 EMF is detected.
The trusted K2 Meter. When moving within a medium range of EMF spots, it will display an accurate value from two to five, and make a clear, audible sound.

A high\-tech ParaReader. This device can track up to three EMF spots at once and has a furthest detection range. It\'ll show the direction, range, and value of each reading at the same time. It plays sounds for each EMF detection so you can hear, from a distance, how many and how strong the readings are.

Ultraviolet evidence can only be seen by shining the UV Light or a Glowstick onto affected surfaces. Pieces of Ultraviolet evidence will glow green while charged by the UV light, and will fade over time.

Left on objects and surfaces by ghosts, the Ultraviolet evidence might be tough to see on smaller items or while in large rooms. Footprints which have been tracked by salt piles also count as Ultraviolet evidence.

When shining a UV light onto Fingerprints or Footprints, you will still see it straight away, but additionally, the light will charge up the print. After putting your UV light away, the print will stay visible for a short period (depending on how long you charged it for), allowing you to take a photo!

A 6\-fingered Handprint may be found which will identify the Ghost type immediately as an Obake.

The classic UV glowstick. After snapping it to turn it on, it projects a short\-range area light that lasts around one minute before dimming. You can always give it another shake to reinvigorate its light.
The classic UV Flashlight which emits a brighter beam with a longer range, boasting a much faster UV charge time!

The UV Light Pro is a chunky flashlight that has a much brighter and wider cone of light, as well as an even quicker charge time. It is perfect for locating Ultraviolet Evidence quickly on a larger scale.

Freezing temperatures are below 0 Celsius. Temperature can be determined by using the Thermometer.

As ghosts pull heat from the surrounding area, temperatures decrease in the room or hallways where the ghost spends the most of its time. All ghosts will eventually cause temperatures below 13 degrees Celsius, but only certain ghost types will drop temperatures below 0 C.

Cold Breath has been reworked. At 5\-7 C or less, anyone within the haunted area will be able to see their breath. If it\'s snowing and the fuse box starts off, you\'ll find Cold Breath instantly everywhere, even in the Truck. Alternatively, if the fuse box is on, so that the house is nice and toasty, you\'ll find Cold Breath appearing only in rooms where the ghost has been long enough to drop their temperature.

The cooling of a room, even by just a slight amount, may take longer than the first few minutes during an investigation. Taking note of oddly low temperatures in early rooms and then doubling back to them is a good idea.

An old house\-Thermometer, ripped straight off of your Investigator\'s living room wall. This Thermometer has a slow sample rate, meaning you\'ll have to wait longer to get an accurate reading. You may want to bring one in and check back on it later in the contract.

An updated version of the classic temperature reader, but much more responsive. Instead of turning it on and getting a reading every two seconds, hold the \'Use\' button to scan for temperatures. This makes running around and checking each room\'s temperatures much faster than Tier I allows for.

A straight upgrade to Tier II, completing temperature scans at double the speed of its predecessor. Additionally, this more modern Thermometer is more accurate with each reading, allowing players to quickly and efficiently scan rooms to find the ghost or to get \"Freezing Temperatures\" ticked off in the Journal.

Determined using the Ghost Writing Book.

Ghosts may write in the book regardless if the book is set down or held in hand. If the ghost writes in the book, this is a piece of Evidence for that ghost type. If Demonic symbols are written, this may be evidence for a Demon, but this is absolutely not definitive as ghost writing styles tend to deviate at random.

A small, floating orb that\'s present only in the room a ghost is haunting. It can be seen only via night vision through the use of the Video Camera or the Head\-Mounted Camera\'s thermal imaging using the truck\'s live camera feed.

Ghost orbs can be quick to spot, but ruling it out too quickly might spell trouble down the road.
An old camcorder that Ghost Huntin\' Distribution found in the attic of the old office. It\'s small and a bit beaten up, but it does the job just fine.
The Parasonic video camera is an HD video that makes finding orbs so much easier. Sadly it still gets a lot of interference from an active ghost.
Bony\'s very own movie\-grade video camera with a large body supports a much larger screen. It features a much clearer video feed and gets less interference from ghost apparitions.

The Spirit Box is item used to communicate with the ghost.

A player must ask questions in Vicinity Chat to an active Spirit Box, both while nearby the ghost and while the lights are off. Before attempting this, check the ghost\'s response parameters such as either \"Responds to people who are alone\" or \"Responds to everyone\" listed on the Truck\'s whiteboard.

Should the ghost answer, the Spirit Box is confirmed Evidence.

Pointed questions such as \"How old are you?\" or \"Where are you?\" are plausible questions. Do keep in mind that the ghost is always listening regardless if a player is talking into a Spirit Box or not, so players should be careful while speaking in Vicinity chat. Drawing out a ghost can be done by saying their given name numerous times (thus, angering it), and giving it commands like \"Show yourself\" or \"Give us a sign\" seem to be plausible commands.
Prevent a hunt with the Crucifix
Have the Ghost walk through Salt
Escape the ghost while it\'s hunting
Repel the hunting ghost with a Smudge stick
Have the ghost blow out a candle
Get an Average Team Sanity of 25% or lower
Do you want to hurt us?
Are you the only one here?
What can we do to help?
